descr: "The findings and interpretation of diagnostic  tests performed on patients, groups of patients, devices, and locations, and/or specimens derived from these. The report includes clinical context such as requesting and provider information, and some mix of atomic results, images, textual and coded interpretations, and formatted representation of diagnostic reports."

fields.name: resourceType
fields.descr: "This is a DiagnosticReport resource"

fields.name: identifier
fields.descr: "Identifiers assigned to this report by the performer or other systems."

fields.name: basedOn
fields.descr: "Details concerning a test or procedure requested."

fields.name: status
fields.descr: "The status of the diagnostic report as a whole."

fields.name: category
fields.descr: "A code that classifies the clinical discipline, department or diagnostic service that created the report (e.g. cardiology, biochemistry, hematology, MRI). This is used for searching, sorting and display purposes."

fields.name: code
fields.descr: "A code or name that describes this diagnostic report."

fields.name: subject
fields.descr: "The subject of the report. Usually, but not always, this is a patient. However diagnostic services also perform analyses on specimens collected from a variety of other sources."

fields.name: context
fields.descr: "The healthcare event  (e.g. a patient and healthcare provider interaction) which this DiagnosticReport per is about."

fields.name: effectiveDateTime
fields.descr: "The time or time-period the observed values are related to. When the subject of the report is a patient, this is usually either the time of the procedure or of specimen collection(s), but very often the source of the date/time is not known, only the date/time itself."

fields.name: effectivePeriod
fields.descr: "The time or time-period the observed values are related to. When the subject of the report is a patient, this is usually either the time of the procedure or of specimen collection(s), but very often the source of the date/time is not known, only the date/time itself."

fields.name: issued
fields.descr: "The date and time that this version of the report was released from the source diagnostic service."

fields.name: performer
fields.descr: "Indicates who or what participated in producing the report."

fields.name: specimen
fields.descr: "Details about the specimens on which this diagnostic report is based."

fields.name: result
fields.descr: "Observations that are part of this diagnostic report. Observations can be simple name/value pairs (e.g. \"atomic\" results), or they can be grouping observations that include references to other members of the group (e.g. \"panels\")."

fields.name: imagingStudy
fields.descr: "One or more links to full details of any imaging performed during the diagnostic investigation. Typically, this is imaging performed by DICOM enabled modalities, but this is not required. A fully enabled PACS viewer can use this information to provide views of the source images."

fields.name: image
fields.descr: "A list of key images associated with this report. The images are generally created during the diagnostic process, and may be directly of the patient, or of treated specimens (i.e. slides of interest)."

fields.name: conclusion
fields.descr: "Concise and clinically contextualized impression / summary of the diagnostic report."

fields.name: codedDiagnosis
fields.descr: "Codes for the conclusion."

fields.name: presentedForm
fields.descr: "Rich text representation of the entire result as issued by the diagnostic service. Multiple formats are allowed but they SHALL be semantically equivalent."

fields.name: text
fields.descr:
"A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it \"clinically safe\" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety."
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: contained
fields.descr:
"These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope."
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: extension
fields.descr:
"May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension."
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: modifierExtension
fields.descr:
"May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions."
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: id
fields.descr:
"The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes."
 derived from Resource
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: meta
fields.descr:
"The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content may not always be associated with version changes to the resource."
 derived from Resource
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: implicitRules
fields.descr:
"A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content."
 derived from Resource
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: language
fields.descr:
"The base language in which the resource is written."
 derived from Resource
 derived from DomainResource

searches.name: category
searches.descr: Which diagnostic discipline/department created the report

searches.name: context
searches.descr: Healthcare event (Episode of Care or Encounter) related to the report

searches.name: diagnosis
searches.descr: A coded diagnosis on the report

searches.name: image
searches.descr: A reference to the image source.

searches.name: performer
searches.descr: Who was the source of the report (organization)

searches.name: result
searches.descr: Link to an atomic result (observation resource)
